title: The fair maid of Dunsore's lamentation. Occasioned by Lord Wigmore, governour of Warwick Castle. Being a full and true relation, how Lord Wigmore enticed fair Isabel of Dunsmore in Warwickshire, a shepherds daughter to his bed; she afterwards perceiving her self with child by him, rather than she would undergo the vulgar disgrace amongst her friends did stab her self; and dyed immediately. Tune of, Troy town. With allowance.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for E. Oliver, at the Golden-Key on Snow-hill, over-against St. Sepulchres-Church,
